subject: RE: [junit] Execution Order
msgSnippet: ... See ActiveTestSuite.  It s cool.  Not sure if it works with JUnit 4, though. Sincerely, Todd.
messageBody:
> Sequentially, although, given the independent nature of
> tests, there's no reason why they shouldn't be executed in
> parallel. Mike Clark's JUnitPerf goes half-way there and runs
> the same test in multiple threads for performance reasons,
> but I don't know of any test runners that run different tests
> in different threads. That'd be neat.

See ActiveTestSuite. It's cool. Not sure if it works with JUnit 4,
though.


Sincerely,
Todd.
